heading: # CSS Reset
headingText: Opinionated base styles for Vuetify projects.
normalizeText1: ress is a modern CSS reset that applies a solid base for stylesheets. It is built on top of [normalize.css](https://github.com/necolas/normalize.css) and adds new features such as specifying `font-family: monospace` for `<code>` elements, removing all `outlines` from elements when hovering, and much much more. Additional information can be found on the [ress GitHub repository](https://github.com/filipelinhares/ress).
normalizeText2: These styles are automatically imported within **src/styles/generic/_reset.scss** and bootstrapped as **Generic** styles within **src/styles/generic/_index.scss**:
warning: The Vuetify style reset is applied globally and affects default elements such as `button` and `input`. This also includes anything located outside of the [v-app](/components/application) component.
resetText1: Below is a list of additional *features* that ress provides over the default **normalize.css** functionality
resetText2: Specify `background-repeat: no-repeat` in all elements and pseudo elements.
Remove the `outline` when hovering in all browsers.
Specify font inheritance of form elements.
Remove the default button styling in all browsers.
Hide content from screens but not screenreaders.
resetText3: For a complete list of all applied styles, see the [ress css stylesheet](https://github.com/filipelinhares/ress/blob/master/ress.css).
